com.gsma.services.rcs.chat

Class ChatService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gsma.services.rcs.JoynService
      • com.gsma.services.rcs.chat.ChatService

  • public class ChatService
extends JoynService
    Chat service offers the main entry point to initiate chat 1-1 and group conversations with contacts. Several applications may connect/disconnect to the API. The parameter contact in the API supports the following formats: MSISDN in national or international format, SIP address, SIP-URI or Tel-URI.
    Author:
    Jean-Marc AUFFRET

      • openSingleChat

        public Chat openSingleChat(ContactId contact)
                    throws JoynServiceException
        Open a single chat with a given contact and returns a Chat instance. The parameter contact supports the following formats: MSISDN in national or international format, SIP address, SIP-URI or Tel-URI.
        Parameters:
        contact - the ContactId
        Returns:
        Chat or null
        Throws:
        JoynServiceException

      • initiateGroupChat

        public GroupChat initiateGroupChat(java.util.Set<ContactId> contacts,
                          java.lang.String subject)
                            throws JoynServiceException
        Initiates a group chat with a group of contact and returns a GroupChat instance. The subject is optional and may be null.
        Parameters:
        contacts - Set of contact identifiers
        subject - Subject
        Throws:
        JoynServiceException

      • setRespondToDisplayReports

        public void setRespondToDisplayReports(boolean enable)
                                throws JoynServiceException
        Set the parameter that controls whether to respond or not to display reports when requested by the remote.

        Only applicable to one to one chat messages.

        Parameters:
        enable - true if respond to display reports
        Throws:
        JoynServiceException
